text: maxKeepAliveRequests is not implemented for the Coyote connector
creator: miles@geekspeak.org

text:
It appears that 4.1.18 has code that intends to fix keep alive behavior.  Upon
setting the maxKeepAliveRequests attribute to 1 and restarting, the same
behavior occurs: Tomcat never closes connection until the timeout.
creator: miles@geekspeak.org

text:
Not quite true.  It was using it's default value of '100' always, and ignoring 
the configuration value.

This is fixed in the CVS, and will appear in 4.1.19.
creator: william.barker@wilshire.com
